articles.content:
Proposal for achieving Korean reunification by federal formula supported
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The proposal for achieving reunification by federal formula is the most just proposal consistent with the reality of Korea. I hope that Korea would be reunified by the Korean people themselves according to this formula and the division of Korea, which has lasted for over half a century, would be terminated at an early date. Thabo Mbuyelwa Mbeki, President of the Republic of South Africa said this when receiving credentials from Pak Kun Gwang, new DPRK Ambassador to the country on Nov. 19.
 Referring to the favorably developing inter-Korean relations, the president noted that South Africa hopes that the DPRK-U.S. relations would be settled through dialogue, and does not want to see the outbreak of another war on the Korean Peninsula.    
 South Africa as a friend of the DPRK wishes the Korean people success in their cause and hopes everything will go on well in Korea, he said.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Pakistan appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Pakistan appointed
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Won Gyu was appointed as DPRK Ambassador to Pakistan, according to a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.

Verdict of "not guilty" given to GI murderers denounced
articles.content:
Verdict of "not guilty" given to GI murderers denounced
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The U.S. military court on Nov. 22 declared not guilty lance corporal walker mark, a motorman, in the wake of the verdict of not guilty given to Fernando Nino, an observer of a U.S. armored car, who ruthlessly crushed schoolgirls to death, according to MBC of South Korea.
 At the trial that day most of nine witnesses whom the U.S. military prosecution summoned made statements favorable for the murderers and witnesses of the defense panel did not appear at the court. But the court rapidly acquitted the murderer before ending the trial.    
 Hearing the news of another verdict of not guilty, the bereaved families and civic organizations lodged a strong protest with the court, charging that the trial was no more than a perfunctory trial staged to give a verdict of not guilty to the GIs. 
 Students of the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils staged a surprise demonstration at Kwanghwamun crossroads that evening demanding the punishment of the GI murderers and the revision of the South Korea-U.S. status of forces agreement.
